title: mRemoteNG to front
author: gschmitt99
body_snippet:
<!-- Bug -->
When the mRemoteNG window is behind another but still partially visible, and click on the client area of mRemoteNG, it is not brought to the front.  There are times it does, and times it does not.  As I write this description this morning, I am messing with multiple tabs open in Chrome, clicking between Chrome and mRemoteNG and different tabs in Chrome.  Sometimes the behavior does not manifest, and sometimes it does.

comments.snippet:
Most likely when you encounter this problem you have an SSH session open I assume?

There are known focus issues with PuTTY sessions due to the way it's implemented...

Reference #290
comments.author: kmscode

comments.snippet:
Yes, I am using SSH.  I'm not familiar with how this project is setup, so is putty actually being used somewhat like a plugin into mRemoteNG?

My issues are even simpler than was was described in 290.  I don't have to switch tabs or anything, just between windows.
comments.author: gschmitt99

comments.snippet:
Putty is a separate process that we just stick inside of the mRemoteNG window. This causes focus issues.

If you click in the putty window, that doesn't appear to be registered to the parent. 

Most likely the solution will be #181
